result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Wayne Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court grants 4 days credit if revoked from probation.

miscConds.notes:
The Department of Corrections shall collect all financial obligations. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

09/29/2022 CORRECTED TO REMOVE THE COSTS AS DOC COLLECTS AND ADD THE FOLLOWING FEE LANGUAGE. THE LANGUAGE ABOVE DOES NOT APPLY AS DOC DOES NOT COLLECT THE COURT COSTS ON THIS CASE:  Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Court orders $50.00/month payments. C-31 to be filed.
09/29/2022 CORRECTED TO REMOVE THE RESTITUTION FROM 22CF2 AS IT WAS TO BE ADDED ONTO CASE 22CF24.DOC SHALL NOT COLLECT ANY RESTITUTION ON THIS CASE FILE.

Must have no contact with D.S. or any other known drug dealers or users. 
Must have no contact with the two victims T.Z. and G.H. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Order for DNA given to defendant in court.. Must report to the Barron County Jail today, 9/20/22, to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Perform 100 hours community service work to be completed within the next three months.
